description: From Ancient Greek πάρεργον (párergon, “subordinate or secondary business; by-work”), neuter of πάρεργος (párergos, “beside the main subject, subordinate, incidental”).

entries.meaning: A piece of work that is supplementary to or a byproduct of a larger work.
examples: […]  the running and control of double agents is a[n]  […]  infinitely complicated task. It could not be done as a parergon by any intelligence department elsewhere  […]
